key_channel_insights.line_content: Over 80% of fares are higher on OTAs, indicating a pronounced premium versus direct channels.
MSE fares are cheaper than the airline in 97% of cases, suggesting a consistent discount advantage.
GDS fares remained higher in about 95% of itineraries, though coverage has slightly improved.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over 80% of fares are priced higher on OTAs than direct channels, reflecting a steady premium.
Around 2% of fares match the airline’s website, showing limited price parity.
OTA-lower instances remain effectively 0%, indicating no cheaper prices than direct.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 13% of itineraries are missing on OTAs, a 1% increase from last week.
Ranges from 84% to 90%+, with slight weekly growth.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 84% of short-haul routes show OTA-higher, with 0% undercutting.
OTA-higher stands at 97–100%, with minimal unavailability or matching.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Fares exceed the direct site in 93% of routes; about 5% remain unavailable.
OTA usage is at 83%, with 17% higher fares when available.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Over 80% are higher on OTAs, with a slight rise from the previous week.
Above 90% of advance bookings have OTA premiums, exceeding close-in levels.

mse_highlights.line_content: 97% are cheaper on MSE, indicating a strong discount trend.
MSE fares above the airline remain negligible at 0%. A slight 0.23% was seen in past periods.
Not-found cases are effectively 0%, showing MSE’s full availability.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 2.86% last week, down from 12%, indicating fewer matched prices.
97% undercut rate, with an approximate 0.20% discount gap.
Nearly 0% last week, stable from earlier periods.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 97% cheaper on MSE last week, averaging 20% savings.
100% cheaper on MSE last week, also ~20% discount.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 97.56% cheaper than direct, showing strong local advantage.
93% cheaper, 7% parity, confirming MSE’s advantage globally.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 98% lower on MSE, ~24% average discount last week.
96% lower, ~14% discount advantage in advance bookings.

gds_highlights.line_content: 95% were higher last week, a slight climb from previous periods.
N/A dropped from 1.5% to 0.7% in a month, showing improved availability.
GDS-lower nearly doubled from 0.6% to 1.3%, indicating emerging discounts.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Declined to 0.7% from 1.5%, indicating broader fare coverage.
At 95% last week, up ~1% from last month.
Climbed from 0.6% to 1.3% in a week, highlighting new undercuts.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 95.7% were higher last week; not-found dropped to 0.71%.
94% were higher last week, while lower fares rose from 0% to 5.9%.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: GDS fares were higher in 96% of cases, slightly up from before.
GDS-lower rose to 8.3%, while GDS-higher dipped to 89.7%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 93.6% were higher, while lower fares rose from 0.5% to 1.6%.
Nearly 99% remain higher, creeping up by 0.3%.
